params.goldenTicketIds: Array of golden ticket IDs (0 if none)
params.toolIds: Array of tool ID arrays (each containing 3 tool IDs)

params.erc20Amount: ERC20 token amount required (only for HYBRID)

returns.bucketStats: Array of remaining books in each bucket
returns.pool1Length: Total number of books in pool 1
returns.pool1Remaining: Number of books remaining in pool 1
returns.pool2Length: Total number of books in pool 2
returns.pool2Remaining: Number of books remaining in pool 2

returns.mints: Array of mint counts corresponding to wallets
returns.wallets: Array of top minter addresses (up to 5)

returns._0: Total number of addresses that have minted at least one book
Array of book IDs owned by the user
Array of Book structs containing full book details
Total number of books minted by the user
Whether the book has been opened
Whether user is whitelisted for round 3

params.basicCount: Number of basic NFTs in bucket
params.bookIds: Array of book IDs for the bucket
params.goldenTicketCount: Number of golden tickets in bucket
params.nullCount: Number of NULL NFTs in bucket

params.bookIds: Array of book IDs for pool 1
Array of book IDs for pool 2

params.tokenIds: Array of NFT token IDs to send

params.merkleProof: Merkle proof for round 3 (empty for other rounds)

onERC1155BatchReceived(address,address,u.details: Implementation of IERC1155Receiver to accept batch ERC1155 tokens

onERC1155Received(address,address,uint25.details: Implementation of IERC1155Receiver to accept ERC1155 tokens

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC-1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Implementation of IERC165 to support interface detection

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

addBook(uint256,uint256,uint256[3],uint2.notice: Add a book to the system

configurePayment(uint256,uint8,uint256,u.notice: Configure payment options for a specific round

getAllRounds().notice: Get all rounds configuration for UI

getPaymentConfig(uint256).notice: Get payment configuration for a specific round

getPoolAndBucketStatus().notice: Get current pool and bucket status

getTotalUniqueMinters().notice: Get total number of unique minters

getUserBooks(address).notice: Get books owned by a user

getUserBooksDetails(address).notice: Get detailed book information for all books owned by a user

getUserTotalMints(address).notice: Get total mints for a specific user

getWhitelistStatus(uint256,address).notice: Check if an address is whitelisted for round 1 or 2

isBookOpened(uint256).notice: Check if book has been opened

isWhitelistedForRound3(address,bytes32[].notice: Check if an address is whitelisted for round 3 using merkle proof

openBook(uint256).notice: Open/summon a book to receive its contents

setRound3MerkleRoot(bytes32).notice: Set merkle root for round 3 whitelist

setWhitelistAllowances(uint256,address[].notice: Set whitelist allowances for rounds 1 and 2
